summary: Forward-thinking Aviation Maintenance Technician with hands-on experience performing quality troubleshooting of all aviation mechanical and electrical subsystems.
skills: Quality Assurance of aircraft parts and subsystems
Troubleshooting and Repairing: auxiliary power units
Troubleshooting and Repairing: propellers & rotor systems
Troubleshooting and Repairing: power train systems
Troubleshooting and Repairing: airframe and systems-specific electrical components
Fixed and movable flight control surfaces
Bleed aircraft air, hydraulic, and fuel systems

experience.title: Aviation Maintenance Technician
experience.description: Accepted and deployed to Aviation Maintenance School. Completed 20 weeks of full time aviation maintenance school in which I was taught how to inspect, service, maintain, troubleshoot and repair aircraft engines, auxiliary power units, propellers, rotor systems, power train systems, and associated airframe and systems-specific electrical components. We serviced, maintained and repaired aircraft fuselages; wings; rotor blades; fixed and movable flight control surfaces; and also bleed aircraft air, hydraulic and fuel systems. I was also trained to filled aircrew positions such as flight engineer, flight mechanic, loadmaster, dropmaster, sensor-systems operator and basic aircrewman.

experience.title: United States Ceremonial Honor Guardsman
experience.description: Hand selected by Drill Instructors to serve two years in the Coast Guard Honor Guard stationed in Washington D.C. where I represented the Coast Guard in high profile events around the world.

experience.title: Setup Department Mechanic
experience.description: Worked for the largest motorcycle dealer/maintenance company in Reno Nevada. In 2005 I was in charge of three personnel to build and deliver new vehicles and repair and deliver used vehicles under strict time constraints. Job consisted of troubleshooting, ordering, and installing parts required for repair with maximum potential profit on used vehicles. Ensuring safety of new and used vehicles before delivery to customers. All customers receiving our products would receive a safety briefing and product demonstration before transferring possession. Accomplishments: 2006 promoted to quality control; 2008 promoted to head Coast Guard Honors; Also, 2008 supported Coast Guard Aviation.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering
